about_the_game:
Good Knight's original soundtrack composed by LEAF XCEED Music Division, available in MP3 320 CBR!

"... What made the most difference in composing music for this game as compared to my other past stints, is that Alex actually wanted to promote my original compositional style, which I call “video game power metal”. I feel I’m an atypical musician in the Philippines, due to my inspirations being international in nature — an unholy fusion of Japanese video game music and European power metal ... I was so scared at first trying to make my music sound like others, but he wanted me to do it my way with some helpful pointers and feedback here and there to fit his vision. We ended up creating a soundtrack the entire team is truly proud of."

- Ramon Nario

name: Good Knight Original Soundtrack
reviews:
“Did I mention that the music goes harder than the demons of hell?”
The Bone Zone

“I’m sure many would agree when I say that the music of this game is the best part of it. It’s described as a metal soundtrack on the game’s store page, and it accompanies the gameplay and the art style of the game perfectly, hyping you up to go against more and more bosses and levels. I genuinely believe that without the music and sound design, the game would not be played to its truest form.”
POP! by INQUIRER

“We also can't talk about Good Knight without mentioning the absolutely rockin' tracks. Some of the best I've ever heard since Lords of Thunder and Ys, and that was a long time ago. They're like a mix between those games and some of ZUN's work on Touhou -- mixing classical instruments with hard rock and speed metal. Just amazing music that you have to hear, and it's perfect for the game. I'm telling you now, it's next-level shit, and it'll have you looking to buy that soundtrack.”
Shmup Junkie
